page.title: 03Energy and Communications
page.content:
Energy
A notable feature of the landscape is the giant 132 Kv pylon power grid which marches across from the NE corner to the SW. All occupied buildings have mains electricity, but only some have mains water.
Transport and Communications
Three minor roads serve the area, and these are now shared by farm and non farm traffic, the latter drawn by the attractions of the river Cam. Most houses are on the phone, having been connected to the nearby village by underground cable. Citizens band radio is used by some farmers. Postal services come from Lode and Swaffham Prior. The Lodes are now barely navigable.
